instructions: Open your device's Settings app . Tap Accessibility , then tap Select to Speak . Note: If you don't see Select to Speak, go to Google Play to download the latest version of Android Accessibility Suite, then try these steps again. At the top, turn on Select to Speak .

Start Select to Speak: 2-finger swipe up (3-finger swipe up if TalkBack is on), or tap the Accessibility button . Learn more about using the Accessibility button or gesture . Tap an item on your screen, like text or an image. To hear multiple items, drag your finger across the screen. To hear everything, tap Play . Tip: When the player is open, use the buttons to pause or play, skip forward or backward and to increase or decrease speed.

Tap the Google Camera app . Point the camera at an image or text. Start Select to Speak: 2-finger swipe up (3-finger swipe up if TalkBack is on), or tap the Accessibility button . Learn more about using the Accessibility button or gesture . Drag your finger across the screen, highlighting the text that you want to read.
Open your device's Settings app . Tap Accessibility , then tap Select to Speak . Tap Settings . At the top, turn on Multi-tasking .
